sentences: Saarik oli hea õpetaja, kuid halb administraator – direktoriks ta ei sobinud.
context: The word 'hotelli' is the genitive case of 'hotell' in Estonian, meaning 'hotel'. In this context, it's part of the compound word 'hotelliadministraator', which refers to an administrator or manager specifically responsible for a hotel. This position handles the day-to-day practical operations and management of the establishment.
